page.title: 12International population
page.content:
Results of survey carried out amongst 200 children at Brookland School on 7th June 1985. The question asked was:Were you born in britain or abroad? & Where were your parents born? We found that 29% of the children were born abroad and 52% of the parents were born abroad.We therefore assume that the majority of people in the parent's generation living in the area were born abroad. The birth places of the parents are widely scattered:
81 from Asia; 50 from Africa; 26 from America; 5 from Australia; and 51 from European countries other than Britain.
The greatest numbers came from Japan and India with even numbers followed by Kenya and South Africa.
